main event: One white, round object, size of a pea having a bright tail was observed for three consecutive nights in Lafayette.
interesting points: The object was observed stationary before moving to the southwest., The sighting occurred over a period of three nights., Weather conditions were clear with good visibility., The case was evaluated as possibly being a star, planet, or balloon., The document noted that all characteristics of an astronomical body were present.
sighted object: one white round object with a bright tail
witness description: There are no specific witness descriptions provided.
